episodes.title: All Nations - Conversation with Eric from Los Angeles (pt I)
episodes.description: Eric joined the teen ministry in Los Angeles in the year 2000 at the age of 14.  Like many of us, Eric was looking for some positivity and community prior to becoming a member of the organization.  The church offered Eric a place of refuge from the world around him; the church offered him a place to fit in.  Eric describes his first encounter with the church and tells us what was like stepping into a diverse and welcoming environment.  Eric describes his time with the teen minisitry and it being filled with fun and  was a distraction from bad influences.    Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: Upside Down - Conversation with Kathy from Indianapolis (pt III)
episodes.description: In the third and final part of our conversation with Kathy, she begins to tell us how she began to leave the ICOC and why.  Kathy explains that after leaving the organization, there was a lot for her to undo as she spent several years with the organization.   28 years after leaving the organization, Kathy now regards it as a cult although she did not have that sentiment before.  Kathy also explains how life has been like for her after leaving.  She describes overcoming physical ailments and battles with mental health in her life and how this spirit of perseverance has helped to mold her into who she is today.  To learn more about Kathy, follow her on instagram at https://www.instagram.com/kathy.baumann.coaching/https://www.facebook.com/groups/645671615631028Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: Indianapolis 1994 - Conversation with Kathy from Indianapolis (pt II)
episodes.description: In the second part to our conversation with Kathy, she begins to explain to us why the church felt the need to tell a large group of members to get rebaptized.   The leaders of the church required certain members of certain churchs to do the indoctrication studies all over again before getting rebaptized.  The church in Indianapolis split from the International Church of Christ in 1994 due to a disagreement in belief and policy.   The leader of the church in Indianapolis made the decision to leave the ICOC.  He spoke about this with the members in attendance on a Sunday morning.  This was an important moment in the history of the ICOC as one part of the congregation chose to leave the ICOC while the other part decided to remain with the ICOC.  The ICOC then regarded these dissenters as fall aways and traitors.  Kathy was a part of this group of people that left and she was in attendance when the leader of the church in Indianapolis made such an announcement.  Join us as she recounts these events.To learn more about Kathy, follow her on instagram at https://www.instagram.com/kathy.baumann.coaching/https://www.facebook.com/groups/645671615631028Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: Reconstruction - Conversation with Kathy from Indianapolis (pt I)
episodes.description: In this episode with meet Kathy from Indianapolis.  Kathy is currently a life coach where she helps her clients do the best they can with what they have.   She has been through much in her life, and now wants to help others to achieve the same type of perseverance.  However, before becoming a life coach, Kathy was a member of the ICOC.   She joined the Indianapolis Church of Christ in 1987 as a college freshman.  She joined during the time of the church’s marked "reconstruction" period.  Unlike many of us, Kathy got baptized twice with the ICOC.  Join us as she explains the surrounding circumstances that required a second baptism and what life was like for her while a member.  To learn more about Kathy, follow her on instagram and Facebook  at https://www.instagram.com/kathy.baumann.coaching/https://www.facebook.com/groups/645671615631028Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: Never To Be Silenced Again - Conversation with Del from London (pt III)
episodes.description: In the third and final installment of our conversation  with Del from London, he explains to us some of the red flags that he has noticed during his time with the organization.  Like many of us, he saw these red flags but chose to ignore them.   According to Del, part of the reason for ignoring the red flags is because we were “so indoctrinated."  The more we discussed, Cousin Eddie’s  noticed that there was a certain level of fear put into the membership in order to maintain order.  We ask Del if he regrets joining the church and his answer is rather complicated.   Del has sacrificed time, personal and professional opportunities in order to "seek the kingdom first."  Del also discusses the concept of a cult and how he came to the realization that he was a part of a cult.  Despite all of that, Del has picked up the pieces to his life and he discusses how he has done so.   Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: Prime Time - Conversation with Del from London (pt. II)
episodes.description: This is the second installment of our three part conversation with Del from London.  Del explains to us what his day to day life looked like while he was in the London Church.  There is much to say on this matter as he has spent the better part of ten years with the organization.    He explains to us the concept of placing members  on “the weak list.”   Del also introduces us to the term “prime time," which was a term the London Church used regarding recruiting.   Del and Aldo explain to Cousin the Eddie the idea of dating within this church and some of the dynamics behind that.  They also discuss how members would attempt to impress other members of the church by how stating how many bible studies one conducted and by how many years one had been a member of the church.   Del gives us his take on why the infamous letter was written and the Sabbatical Letter that preceded it.   Del also mentions the levels of control that the London church imposed on the membership by doing such things as banning particular books.  SPECIAL NOTEThis conversation was recorded before Matthew joined us and gave his take on the timeline of the release of the letter.  Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: We Called It The Kingdom: Conversation with Del from London (pt I)
episodes.description: Today we welcome back Del from London.  We met him on episode 2 when he recounted some of the events of the fallout regarding the infamous letter.  This time around, Del recounts his story of how he became involved with the ICOC.  He talks about being attracted to the church’s diversity and palpable energy that was on display at the first Sunday Service that he attended.  He then desicribes the last time that he attended the church and what led him to make the decision to leave.  Del spent 10 years with the London Church of Christ.  Del describes himself as a committed soilder for the organization.  After giving his 20’s to this organization, Del begins to wonder if he wasted his time.  Join us as Del takes us on a trip down his memory lane.  Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: Take Back Your Life: Conversation with Renowned Cult Expert Dr. Lalich (pt III)
episodes.description: In the final part of our conversation with Dr. Lalich, she explains to us how she eventually left the cult that she was a part of and tells us how she took back her life.Dr. Lalich is a world-renowned expert in cultic studies. She is the auuthor and co-author of several critically acclaimed books on cults. She is an avid contributor to the field of cultic studies through her research, presentations, articles, and documentaries.  Janja Lalich, Ph.D. is a researcher, author, and educator specializing in self-sealing, or closed, systems (cults, human trafficking, situations of coercive influence and control, ideological extremism), with a particular focus on recruitment, indoctrination, and methods of influence and control. She is Professor Emerita of Sociology at California State University, Chico and has been studying the social psychology of controversial groups and exploitative and abusive relationships for 30+ years. Dr. Lalich has written and lectured extensively, has advised the international intelligence community on extremism and indoctrination, and has served as consultant and expert witness in civil and criminal cases.  In addition, Dr. Lalich is a cofounder of the Take Back Your Life Recovery program.  The Take Back Your Life Recovery program  is a collaborative effort between Dr. Janja Lalich, and two experienced mental-health professionals: Beth Matenaer, Licensed Professional Counselor and Sally Martin, Licensed Clinical Social Worker. They develop and facilitate psychoeducational interactive sessions and practical healing tools for survivors of cults or other types of closed or extremist groups, coercive and high-demand environments, and destructive and controlling relationships. The aim of the program is to provide the information and resources our clients need to effectively heal from a variety of harmful and/or traumatic personal experiences. Additionally, they create course material and training sessions to educate and train helping professionals to better assist such clients.Visit https://janjalalich.com  to find out more about Dr. Lalich.  You can also follow her on twitter or instagramhttps://twitter.com/Janja_Lalich https://twitter.com/TBYLRhttps://www.instagram.com/janja_lalich/Books by Dr. Lalich:Escaping Utopia: Growing Up in a Cult, Getting Out, and Starting Over, 2017Take Back Your Life, 2006Bounded Choice, 2004Crazy Therapies, 1996Cults In Our Midst, 1995Captive Hearts, Captive Minds, 1994Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: London Has Fallen: Conversation with the Man Who Revealed "The Letter"
episodes.description: As chance would have it, we had the fortuitous opportunity to speak with Matthew this week.  Matthew was a member of the London Church of Christ and is the man that leaked the letter in February of 2003.  Because this conversation sprung up so suddenly, and helps us to explain the story of this letter and its effects even further, we thought that it was necessary to make it available to our audience as soon as possible.  Therefore, it’s being released today, April 9, 2022, unexpectedly, unscheduled, and in its entirety.  Matthew describes an upheaval that was birthed in the United Kingdom.  He describes a people who were beginning to voice their frustrations with the church until those voices became a collective. Until that collective became fuel for the creation of a letter.  Until the letter was prematurely released and reset the trajectory of the organization.  In February 2003 Matthew stood up for himself.  He stood up for the people.  He stood up to the International Church of Christ.  On behalf of thousands of people around the globe, we thank you Matthew.  "Honest To God" by Henry Kriete       http://www.reveal.org/library/stories/people/hkriete.htmWARNINGSome of the content of this episode deals with suicide.  If you or someone you know is having suicidal thoughts or ideations, please know that support is available through the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline. or call 1-800-273-TALK  Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: The Letter: A Tale of Two Cities (New York)
episodes.description: Today we meet Del from New York.  He gives us his accounts, as he remembers them, of that time.  As the effects of "The Letter" became more and more widespread,  the New York City church began to feel the effects as well.  The church became a shell of itself.  Membership declined.  Attendance declined.  Monetary contribution declined.  There were regular everyday members of the church rebelling against the teachings and directions of the leaders.  Many people began to question their place in the church and question their involvement with the church.  Many members challenged leaders verbally and even confronted them in person.  Many of the church leaders left.   According to Del from New York, "things would never be the same."    Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: The Letter: A Tale of Two Cities (London)
episodes.description: Today we meet Del from London.  Del was a disciple in the London church for several years.  "The Letter" originated in England and began to wreck havoc on the structure and culture of the London Church.   As the ramifications of "The Letter" reached different parts and regions, the church decided to send a leader to London in attempts to quell the uproar.  There was a leaders meeting in East London, where the letter was addressed.  According to Del "that was the moment when the London Church changed."  Del was at this meeting and recounts the events of that day for us.  For the record, the order of events are not necessarily told in sequential order, but the spirit and sentiment of the auditorium is captured in Del's recollection of the events.  Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B. episodes.title: For The People
episodes.description: In the Season 2 opener,  Eddie and Aldo pick up where they left off.  Season 2 of The Reclamation Podcast is all about what life was like as a member of the ICOC; why people have left the ICOC;  what life is like after leaving the ICOC.  Cousin Eddie and Aldo B. Martin bring their style of light hearted conversation to a potentially heavy topic.  The duo recap their thoughts on season 1, but then begin to discuss “the letter.”  The Henry Kriete Letter of 2003 set the International Church of Christ off of its axis and trajectory, temporarily.  The Letter had ramifications in different parts of the church all over the world.  Aldo tells Cousin Eddie about some of those immediate ramifications that he witnessed at that time.  Support the showStay updated on Aldo's current and future projects by signing up for his NewsletterOther Podcasts by Aldo B.
